item.title: Blue Origin’s satellite internet network TeraWave will move data at 6Tbps
item.dc:creator: Sean O'Kane
item.description: The network will be designed for enterprise, data center, and government customers and could offer an alternative to SpaceX's Starlink service.

item.title: Zipline charts drone delivery expansion with $600M in new funding
item.dc:creator: Kirsten Korosec
item.description: The startup plans to expand to at least four new U.S. states in 2026.

item.title: OpenEvidence hits $12B valuation, with new round led by Thrive, DST
item.dc:creator: Julie Bort
item.description: The medical info database has doubled in valuation since last raise in October, despite encroachment from model makers.

item.title: Threads rolls out ads to all users worldwide
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description: Ads on Threads will roll out gradually to users over the coming months, Meta says.

item.title: YouTube TV’s multiview is getting a huge upgrade, letting viewers mix and match channels
item.dc:creator: Lauren Forristal
item.description: Soon, YouTube TV will allow viewers to customize the multiview feature to watch any four channels they want side by side.

item.title: We’re not nostalgic for 2016 — we’re nostalgic for the internet before all the slop
item.dc:creator: Amanda Silberling
item.description: At the time, people felt like 2016 was cursed -- but at least we did not yet have a word for "doomscrolling."

item.title: OpenAI’s former sales leader joins VC firm Acrew: OpenAI taught her where startups can build a ‘moat’
item.dc:creator: Julie Bort
item.description: Aliisa Rosenthal has found a new career as a VC. She knows what startups can do to protect themselves from the model makers eating their markets.

item.title: YouTube will soon let creators make Shorts with their own AI likeness
item.dc:creator: Aisha Malik
item.description: YouTube Shorts viewers might soon see AI versions of their favorite creators when scrolling through their feeds.

item.title: OpenAI aims to ship its first device in 2026, and it could be earbuds
item.dc:creator: Ivan Mehta
item.description: The AI startup is on track to announce its first hardware device in the second half of this year, OpenAI Chief Global Affairs Officer Chris Lehane said during an interview at Davos.

item.title: TechCrunch Disrupt 2026 tickets now on sale: Lowest rates all year
item.dc:creator: TechCrunch Events
item.description: TechCrunch Disrupt 2026 tickets are officially on sale. Save up to $680 on your ticket and be among the first 500 registrants to score a plus-one pass at 50% off. Don't miss 10,000 tech leaders, founders, and VCs in San Francisco from October 13-15. Register before these one-time deals vanish.

item.title: Adobe Acrobat now lets you edit files using prompts, generate podcast summaries
item.dc:creator: Ivan Mehta
item.description: Adobe is adding AI tools to Acrobat, including the ability to generate podcast summaries of files, create presentations, and a way for users to edit files using prompts.

item.title: NYT Games’ Scrabble-like game Crossplay is a dream come true
item.dc:creator: Amanda Silberling
item.description: This new Scrabble-inspired game is a distraction-free alternative to ad-loaded competitors like Words With Friends.

item.title: PraxisPro raises $6M seed from AlleyCorp to coach medical sales reps
item.dc:creator: Dominic-Madori Davis
item.description: PraxisPro, founded by a former pharma sales rep, offers small language model AI training specifically designed for medical product sales.

item.title: Lemonade launches an insurance product for Tesla Full Self-Driving customers
item.dc:creator: Sean O'Kane
item.description: Lemonade says it worked with Tesla to gain access to previously-restricted vehicle telemetry data, but declined to offer specifics.

item.title: Eternal CEO Deepinder Goyal hands over reins to Blinkit chief as quick commerce takes off
item.dc:creator: Jagmeet Singh
item.description: Deepinder Goyal will remain on Eternal's board as its vice chairman.

item.title: Zanskar thinks 1 TW of geothermal power is being overlooked
item.dc:creator: Tim De Chant
item.description: Zanskar has raised $115 million to find about a dozen geothermal resources that could help power the grid throughout the U.S. West.

item.title: Language learning marketplace Preply’s unicorn status embodies Ukrainian resilience
item.dc:creator: Anna Heim
item.description: Language learning marketplace Preply is now valued at $1.2 billion after raising a $150 million Series D round that marks a new chapter for the 14-year-old company.

item.title: India’s app downloads rebounded to 25.5 billion in 2025, fueled by AI assistants and microdrama boom
item.dc:creator: Ivan Mehta
item.description: India is a country of extremes when it comes to app usage. It continues to top global app downloads but doesn't feature in the top 20 markets in terms of consumer spending, according to a new report by market intelligence firm Sensor Tower.

item.title: Consumers spent more on mobile apps than games in 2025, driven by AI app adoption
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description: Consumers spent more money in mobile apps than games in 2025, driven by AI app adoption.

item.title: Snap reaches settlement in social media addiction lawsuit
item.dc:creator: Ivan Mehta
item.description: The lawsuit against Snap was brought by a 19-year-old known in court documents as K.G.M., accusing the social media app of designing algorithms and features that caused addiction and mental health issues.
